question_sentence: The Liberal Party came out on top in Canada's election, winning how many seats?
evidence: The centre-left party, led by former Bank of England governor Mark Carney, pulled off a stunning reversal of fortunes since former leader Justin Trudeau dissolved parliament in January amid a crisis of confidence. Carney's tough rhetoric on Donald Trump's taunts and tariffs saw the party surge in the polls – although it still fell short of the 172 seats needed for a majority.

question_sentence: Researchers admitted carrying out a secret AI experiment using which platform?
evidence: A team of researchers conducted a month-long secret experiment on Reddit users using AI chatbots to post over 1,700 comments in its r/changemyview forum. The bots used an AI data scraper to gather and analyse users' personal data without consent, raising questions on whether deception is ever justified when conducting research on human subjects.

question_sentence: Liverpool clinched their record-equalling 20th Premier League title with a 5-1 win over which side?
evidence: Liverpool's victory capped a triumphant first season for manager Arne Slot, and puts the Reds alongside Manchester United as the joint most successful club in English league history. Liverpool first won the title in 1901 and are now level with United on 20.

question_sentence: Which company provoked an angry backlash from the White House over plans to display the impact of tariffs alongside product prices?
evidence: Donald Trump personally called Amazon's founder Jeff Bezos to complain after reports surfaced claiming that the company planned to list the additional cost of Trump's tariffs alongside product prices. Amazon later clarified that the idea was a misunderstanding and was never going to happen.

question_sentence: Which cardinal and convicted fraudster abandoned his bid to join the papal conclave?
evidence: Becciu had insisted that, despite having his cardinal privileges taken away after being charged with financial crimes in 2020, he had the right to vote for Pope Francis' successor. But this had proven a headache for the College of Cardinals. However, the surprise emergence of letters signed by the late pontiff apparently barring Becciu from the conclave forced the disgraced cardinal to back down.

question_sentence: According to a recent study, which animal species takes the longest time for wounds to heal?
evidence: A team of biologists found that humans wounds take two to three times longer to heal than those on other mammals. They suggest the slower healing may have been an evolutionary trade-off when we shed fur for sweat glands.

question_sentence: The number of British children playing which instrument has almost halved over the last decade?
evidence: Once a staple of school bands, the recorder now "risks going the way of the lute and the harpsichord", said The Times. A survey revealed that only 16% of children aged 5-17 play the instrument today, compared to 28% in 2014. The ukelele and guitar are increasingly used in music lessons, while the overall proportion of children learning an instrument in their spare time has dropped.

question_sentence: How did a $60 million US Navy fighter jet end up in the Red Sea?
choices: It ran out of fuel mid-air
It was shot down by enemy fire
It slipped off an aircraft carrier
evidence: An F/A-18E Super Hornet fighter jet was "lost at sea" when it slipped off the deck of the USS Harry S. Truman. The aircraft carrier was attempting to evade incoming fire from Houthi rebels in Yemen, but the jet plunged into the Red Sea along with the tractor towing it into the hangar bay.

question_sentence: The late Joan Didion's private reflections on her therapy sessions have been published as a book, entitled "Notes to" who?
evidence: Didion's reflections on her sessions with her psychiatrist – addressed to her husband, John Gregory Dunne – were found in a filing cabinet beside her desk after her death in December 2021. Didion had never indicated any intention of making them public, and the decision to do so after her death has elicited a debate about the ethics of posthumous publishing.

question_sentence: There was outrage in Brazil after reports that the national football team might adopt what new shirt colour for the 2026 World Cup?
evidence: Right-wing Brazilians lashed out after reports that the Brazilian Football Confederation is considering changing the national team's kit to include a red shirt for the 2026 World Cup. The colour is associated with left-wing President Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva.

question_sentence: A judge in Wisconsin was recently arrested for allegedly doing what?
choices: Helping an undocumented immigrant avoid arrest
evidence: Judge Hannah Dugan’s arrest drew intense criticism from legal experts and Democratic lawmakers.

question_sentence: President Donald Trump recently announced the creation of a “FEMA Review Council” to reform the disaster relief agency. Which of the following people is not on the council?
evidence: First lady Melania Trump is not a member of the FEMA Review Council, which will seek to enact reforms that honor Trump’s executive order to shift more responsibility for disaster response and recovery to states rather than the federal government, as CNN has reported.

question_sentence: The latest class to be inducted into the Rock & Roll Hall of Fame was announced this week. Where will the induction ceremony take place?
evidence: The induction ceremony will take place in Los Angeles this fall.

question_sentence: Actor John Stamos recently completed a YouTube channel’s challenge to create a new drum section for a song he’d never heard before. Which song was it?
evidence: He was challenged to create a new drum section for “Last Resort” by Papa Roach.

question_sentence: A mural depicting Kobe Bryant and his daughter Gianna was vandalized recently in Los Angeles. Which basketball star paid the entire expected cost of restoring the artwork?
evidence: Luka Dončić donated $5,000 to restore the “Mambas Forever” mural in downtown Los Angeles. The Slovenian superstar joined the Lakers less than three months ago in a blockbuster trade with the Dallas Mavericks.

question_sentence: Canadian voters reelected which party to run the government?
evidence: Voters have returned Canada’s Liberal Party, led by Prime Minister Mark Carney, to power for a fourth consecutive term.

question_sentence: Which fate befell a $60 million US Navy F/A-18 Super Hornet fighter jet this week?
choices: It caught fire on a runway
It was hit by a fueling truck
It fell off an aircraft carrier
evidence: The jet was lost at sea after it fell overboard the USS Harry S. Truman aircraft carrier.

question_sentence: The world’s largest solar telescope just offered its first detailed close-up of which celestial body?
evidence: The US National Science Foundation Daniel K. Inouye Solar Telescope showed a detailed image of the sun, the Earth’s nearest star.

question_sentence: The US signed a rare earth minerals deal with which country this week?
evidence: The US and Ukraine signed an agreement that will give Washington preferential access to Kyiv’s rare earth minerals in exchange for providing funding for reconstruction.

question_sentence: Ten people are on trial in Paris for allegedly carrying out a dramatic heist of nearly $10 million in cash and jewelry. Who was the victim?
evidence: Reality TV star Kim Kardashian was bound, gagged and robbed at gunpoint in 2016.
